basic_information.scholarship_name: Harvey Mankins Industrial Safety Student of Courage Scholarship
basic_information.committee_name: CEPS - Harvey Mankins Industrial Safety Student of

description: Scholarship Mission: To provide scholarship assistance to students within the College of Education & Professional Studies who are majoring in Industrial or Occupational Safety. Eligibility Requirements Open to any student majoring in Industrial or Occupational Safety Minimum 2.75 GPA Enrolled in a minimum of (6) hours Good academic standing in the BS-Industrial Safety degree program or the Med  General Education or Adult and Higher Education: Interdisciplinary Studies (Specialization Area  Industrial Safety) Provides a letter of recommendation from one off-campus source Provides a personal statement that explains why they exemplify those characteristics displayed by Harvey during his time in school including: dedication, perseverance, commitment, and that have endured some kind of hardship working toward their degree, be it financial or physical Selection Process Recipients of the scholarship will be selected by a departmental committee Award Requirements Must be enrolled in the upcoming fall and spring semester to receive award Attendance at an awards banquet is required for all recipients Recipients must write a thank you letter to the donors of the scholarship

qualifying_criteria.description: Hard requirements that must be met to qualify for the scholarship

criteria.description: SIS_College is Education and Prof Studies
criteria.raw_text: SIS_College is Education and Prof Studies

criteria.description: Complete Application: "UCO Foundation Qualifying Scholarship Application"
